articles.title: Top 5 AI Crypto Presales To Join: IPO Genie Launches With Smart Deal Flow Utility
articles.author: Crypto Economy
articles.summary: AI is starting to think for crypto. From predictive investing to self-learning blockchains, Artificial Intelligence is now the nervous system of Web3. There are a handful of projects weaving AI directly into the architecture of how crypto works, trades, and scales.

articles.title: Microsoft may ship Nvidia chips to UAE that Donald Trump said he will not give to China; here's the 'deal'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Microsoft will ship Nvidia's most advanced artificial intelligence chips to the United Arab Emirates as part of a deal approved by the US Commerce Department. In an announcement, the software giant said that licenses are not just acts of faith, they're not just an act of faith.

articles.title: AI in Manufacturing: What's Now—and What's Next?
articles.author: Wojciech Matusik
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the manufacturing industry. It will become more prevalent in the everyday operations of manufacturers in the next year or two. McKinsey's research shows 78% of organizations now use AI in at least one business function, up from 72% earlier in the year.

articles.title: Area students learn how to use AI in classrooms, while avoiding pitfalls
articles.author: Daniel Dunaief
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence presents both an opportunity and a challenge in an educational setting. Federal and state regulations limit the use of artificial intelligence that could gather information about students, teachers and principals. However, schools are using AI-infused tools to prepare students to understand the benefits and potential limitations of the technology.

articles.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
articles.author: CATHY BUSSEWITZ
articles.summary: Judges around the world are seeing error-riddled legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence. Many employers want to employ the technology. Experts suggest treating AI as an assistant whose work needs to be checked and not just the legal profession.

articles.title: Midterms and AI: How students are avoiding AI detection
articles.author: Levi Goldstein
articles.summary: Levi Goldstein for Pangram explains how students are avoiding AI detection for midterms. They use AI programs called humanizers and auto-typers to fool AI detectors. They also use fake notes, outlines and Google Docs history to fool the AI. They might turn in a corrupted file to avoid detection.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 7:29 a.m. EST
articles.summary: Zico Kolter is a professor and a member of the OpenAI safety panel. The panel has the power to stop OpenAI from releasing new AI systems if they are deemed unsafe by the panel and can stop them from being released.    .
